results.title: Sydney city life: 1899-1948
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: Explores the changes to inner city life in Sydney through five decades in a black and white production with a musical backdrop and without narration. Chronicles the story of ever-changing fashions, transport, architecture and everyday life and work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.description: Explores the changes to inner city life in Sydney through five decades in a black and white production with a musical backdrop and without narration. Chronicles the story of ever-changing fashions, transport, architecture and everyday life and work.
description_for_label: Explores the changes to inner city life in Sydney through five decades in a black and white production with a musical backdrop and without narration. Chronicles the story of ever-changing fashions, transport, architecture and everyday life and work.

results.title: Sydney at war: the untold story
results.creator_credit: Claude Gonzalez, Tamara Popper, Bavarian Film Studios, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Intriguing documentary about a midget submarine attack on Sydney Harbour by the Japanese during World War II. On the evening of 1st June 1942, a surprise offensive left twenty-one allied and six Japanese dead. Survivors, witnesses and relatives, from both Australia and Japan, recount their memories of the event and how it still affects their lives today. A moving portrait of a singular incident that brought the realisation that the war was not an event happening overseas - how prepared was Australia for invasion? Using a mixture of archival, contemporary footage and interviews (and with a moving musical score composed by Sam Petty) this poignant documentary recalls in a personal way the lives and losses of those caught up in the perils of war. Written, directed and co-produced by Claude Gonzalez.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Claude Gonzalez, Tamara Popper, Bavarian Film Studios, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Australian Film Commission

Using a mixture of archival, contemporary footage and interviews (and with a moving musical score composed by Sam Petty) this poignant documentary recalls in a personal way the lives and losses of those caught up in the perils of war. results.title: Switch on Bigga
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Electricity Commission of New South Wales (N.S.W.), Stanley Hawes, Lee Robinson and Australia. Dept. of the Interior. Film Division
results.brief_description: A unique look at the coming of electric power to a small rural district in NSW and the benefits derived from electricity by the farmer and his family. Includes a country style grand switching on ceremony.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Electricity Commission of New South Wales (N.S.W.), Stanley Hawes, Lee Robinson and Australia. Dept. of the Interior. Film Division
